messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] sic
messages.msgSnippet: ... For some reason I always liked ob (because). I used to use it for shorthand while taking notes. Of course no one else could understand it LOL! I had to
messages.messageBody:
> One of my two favorite Latin words. The other is stat---immediately.

For some reason I always liked ob (because). I used to use it for shorthand
while taking notes. Of course no one else could understand it LOL! I had
to give folks a heads up if they were borrowing my notes.

Stephanie E.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sic
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/25/2002 10:47:45 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Latin for thus meaning that that was exactly how it was written by the original author.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/25/2002 10:47:45 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> I know this sounds uneducated of me but it's something I see now and then
> and have never figured out what it means.
>
> What does "[sic]" mean?

Latin for "thus" meaning that that was exactly how it was written by the
original author. Usually a misspelling or a grammatical error.

One of my two favorite Latin words. The other is stat---immediately.

~Kelly




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
